title: Which authors have influenced Thomas Pynchon? - Quora

response.answer_text: Pynchon mentions influences such as T.S. Eliot, Hemingway, and the Beat movement in his introduction to Slow Learner.   As a young man, Pynchon was influenced by Thomas Wolfe, F. Scott Fitzgerald, Lord Byron, Henry James, Nelson Algren, William Faulkner, and others. See "Thomas Pynchon at Twenty-Two: A recovered Autobiographical Sketch" by Steven Weisenburger; American Literature, Volume 62, Number 4. A good compilation of other sources can be found here: That Which Has Seemingly Influenced Thomas Pynchon
